text: urllib (particularly urllib2) handles many things by default or has appropriate libs to do so.
For example, urllib2 will follow redirects automatically and you can use cookiejar to handle login scripts.
These are all things you'd have to code yourself if you were using httplib.
If you're dealing solely with http/https and need access to HTTP specific stuff, use httplib.
For all other cases, use urllib2.
urllib/urllib2 is built on top of httplib.
It offers more features than writing to httplib directly.
however, httplib gives you finer control over the underlying connections.
If you need highlevel stuff like Caching, Keep-Alive, Compression or Authentication you should take a look at google's pythhon httlip implementation.
Try requests, it`s very simple and powerful module, based on urllib2
Remember that in Python 3.x urllib and urllib2 have been unified into a single module urllib.
So 2.x urllib and 3.x urllib are NOT the same modules.
